member.name: T:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters
member.summary: DosBox command line parameters see: DosBox Wiki: Usage

member.name: M:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Create new instance to DosBoxParameters with parameters for DosBox application

member.name: M:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create new instance to DosBoxParameters with parameters for DosBox application

summary.para: If name is a directory, DOSBox will mount the specified directory as the C drive.
If name is an executable, DOSBox will mount the directory of name as the C drive, and start executing name.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Exit
member.summary: DOSBox will close itself when the DOS application name ends.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Commands
member.summary: Runs the specified command before running name. Multiple commands can be specified. Each command should start with -c though. A command can be: an Internal Program, a DOS command or an executable on a mounted drive.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Fullscreen
member.summary: Starts DOSBox in fullscreen mode.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.UserConf
member.summary: Load the configuration from the user's profile or home directory. This is the default behavior, so this switch is useful when using -conf, below.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Configurations
member.summary: Load the config file specified in configfilelocation. Useful for specifying particular options for specific games. If used after -userconf, or if you use multiple -conf switches, options present in multiple configs will be overwritten by the last, except for autoexec entries, which will be appended in order.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Languages
member.summary: Start DOSBox using the language string specified in languagefilelocation.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Machine
member.summary: Setup DOSBox to emulate a specific type of machine. Valid choices are: hercules, cga, ega, pcjr, tandy, svga_s3 (default) as well as the additional svga chipsets listed in the DOSBox configuration file. The machinetype affects the video card and the available sound cards.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.NoConsole
member.summary: Start DOSBox without showing the console window, output will be redirected to stdout.txt and stderr.txt. This is useful if DOSBox crashes, since the error messages stored in stdout.txt and stderr.txt may help the developers fixing the problem.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.StartMapper
member.summary: Enter the mapper directly on startup. Useful for people with keyboard or joystick problems.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.NoAutoexec
member.summary: Skips the [autoexec] section of the loaded configuration file.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.SecureMode
member.summary: Same as -noautoexec, but adds config.com -securemode at the bottom of AUTOEXEC.BAT (which in turn disables any changes to how the drives are mounted inside DOSBox).

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Scaler
member.summary: Uses the scaler specified by "scaler". See the DOSBox configuration file for the available scalers.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.ForceScaler
member.summary: Similar to the -scaler parameter, but tries to force usage of the specified scaler even if it might not fit.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Version
member.summary: output version information and exit. (see stdout.txt) Useful for frontends.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.EditConfs
member.summary: calls program with as first parameter the configuration file. You can specify this command more than once. In this case it will move to second program if the first one fails to start.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.OpenCaptures
member.summary: calls program with as first parameter the location of the captures folder.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.PrintConf
member.summary: prints the location of the default configuration file.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.ResetConf
member.summary: removes the default configuration file.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.ResetMapper
member.summary: removes the mapperfile used by the default clean configuration file.

member.name: P:TioRACLab.DosBox.DosBoxParameters.Socket
member.summary: passes the socket number to the nullmodem emulation.

member.name: T:TioRACLab.DosBox.Options.CPUCore
member.summary: CPU core used in emulation

member.name: F:TioRACLab.DosBox.Options.CPUCore.Auto
member.summary: Real-mode programs are run with the normal core. For protected mode programs it switches to dynamic core, if available.

member.name: F:TioRACLab.DosBox.Options.CPUCore.Dynamic
member.summary: The program instructions are, in blocks, translated to host processor instructions that execute directly. See also [1]. In the most cases this approach is more efficent than interpretation, except for programs that employ massive self-modifying code. This option is not present on all host platforms.

member.name: F:TioRACLab.DosBox.Options.CPUCore.Normal
member.summary: The program is interpreted instruction by instruction. This approach is a lot more CPU demanding than dynamic core but allows for a more fine-grained time emulation and is needed on platforms for which DOSBox doesn't have a dynamic core.

member.name: F:TioRACLab.DosBox.Options.CPUCore.Simple
member.summary: Basically the same as normal, but optimized for real-mode (older) games. In case a protected-mode game is started, it automatically switches back to normal core.

member.summary: For realmode games, this option switches to realmode default number of cycles or 3000 if not specified.

member.name: F:TioRACLab.DosBox.Options.CPUCycles.MAX
member.summary: Automatically sets the cycles so approximately the (optional) default%-value of your host CPU is used. If the value is not specified it defaults to 100%.

summary.para: The CPU section controls how DOSBox tries to emulate the CPU, how fast the emulation should be, and to adjust it. DOSBox offers 4 different methods of CPU emulation.
See more in CPU Configuriotn DOSBox Wiki page

member.summary: The MPU-401 can work in two modes, normal mode and UART mode. "Normal mode" would provide the host system with an 8-track sequencer, MIDI clock output, SYNC 24 signal output, Tape Sync and a metronome; as a result of these features, it is often called "intelligent mode"
